# Web Homework - AI Coding Agent Instructions

## Project Overview
A web development homework project containing a personal CV/resume in HTML format (`mycv.html`). This is a foundational educational project focused on front-end web development fundamentals.

## Architecture & Key Files
- **`mycv.html`** - Main deliverable; single-page HTML document containing CV content and styling
  - Likely includes semantic HTML structure
  - May contain inline CSS styling
  - Entry point for any web-based homework requirements

## Development Approach

### For HTML/Content Changes
- Edit `mycv.html` directly with proper semantic HTML elements (`<header>`, `<section>`, `<article>`, `<footer>`, etc.)
- Maintain consistent indentation (2 or 4 spaces)
- Use semantic HTML structure over generic `<div>` elements when appropriate
- Keep CSS organized (either inline in `<style>` tags or in separate files if project expands)

### For Adding Features
- Consider single-file approach initially (no separate files unless significant complexity arises)
- If adding CSS: use `<style>` block in `<head>`
- If adding interactivity: use inline `<script>` or separate `.js` file in same directory
- Maintain responsive design principles for cross-device compatibility

## Patterns to Follow
- **Semantic HTML**: Use proper heading hierarchy (`<h1>` â†’ `<h6>`), structured content
- **Accessibility**: Include `alt` attributes for images, semantic landmarks, proper contrast
- **File organization**: Keep related assets in same directory unless project scales

## Common Tasks
- Updating CV content: Edit text within semantic elements in `mycv.html`
- Styling changes: Modify CSS within `<style>` block or add new classes
- Testing: View in browser (open `mycv.html` directly or via local server)
- Version control: Commit changes with descriptive messages explaining updates

## Git Workflow
- Work directly in main/master branch for this homework project
- Commit after each meaningful change with clear messages
- No complex branching strategy needed for solo homework project
